post_text: Very cool stuff.... an awesome opportunity for our students to talk with two successful Lemont High School alums! #GoLemont #BlueRibbonSchool
shared_text:
Lemont High School
October 19, 2018 at 4:19 PM ·

Lemont High School's Creative Writing students had a special treat on a Friday afternoon... a double Google Meet in the #CITGOInnovationAcademy with two accomplished alums! The class had a chance to chat with Ed Kulzer '96 and his sister, Alex Fletcher (that's her pseudonym; she was Tracy Kulzer '95). Ed, who joined the chat from New York, has had a diverse career in the creative arts. He recently won an "Outstanding Multiple Camera Editing" Emmy for his work on Sesame Street! Alex, who took part in the conversation from Los Angeles, has enjoyed a successful writing career. Her trilogy - "Light as a Feather" - not only was picked up by Simon & Schuster for publication, but recently made into a television series by Hulu (Light as a Feather- Hulu)! Our students certainly benefited from hearing how Ed and Alex have used their creative gifts to succeed! Their mom, Patricia LaPorte, sat in on the session with the students... likely beaming with pride! #GoLemont #BlueRibbonSchool #ILSchoolStories

The Indians picked up their fifth IHSA Medium Division State Championship this afternoon and earned their 11th state trophy. The five state titles is tied for the most in the history of the IHSA State Series in cheerleading, and the 11 state trophies are far and away a state record. The Lemont High School varsity football team will travel to Peoria Richwoods this Saturday as they look to advance to the IHSA Class 6A state championship.

The top-seeded Indians (12-0) will take on the No. 5 Knights (9-3) at 2 p.m. at Richwoods High School, 6301 North University St. in Peoria., the Illinois High School Association announced Monday.

According to Tony Hamilton, director of school and community relations for Lemont High School, there will be a presale of tickets on Wednesday and Thursday. The school may also be putting together a fan bus.

More information will be available later this week, he said.

In the 6A quarterfinals Saturday, the Indians eliminated Chicago Hubbard with a convincing 29-0 win. Peoria Richwoods beat Danville 20-19.
